item.title: A stochastic process crib sheet
item.description: A one-page crib sheet for stochastic process is attached here.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Short Bio I am a Ph.D. candidate in Operations Research at Georgia Tech, working with Dr. Andy Sun. I am interested in the theory and application of optimization in a broad sense. I am currently working on distributed and decomposition algorithms for nonconvex optimization, which find their applications in large-scale continuous and discrete problems arising from engineering, especially power systems, and data science. Before joining the Ph.D. program, I received my B.

item.title: Experience
item.description: Grid Optimization Competition I have been participating in the ARPA-E Grid Optimization Competition (GO Competition). Entrant teams from around the globe thrive to develop innovative algorithmic softwares for modern power grids in the form of coding competition. Our team (GMI-GO) is led by faculty advisors Prof. X. Andy Sun (PI) and Prof. Santanu Dey, and it has been a pleasure for me working with and learning from wonderful teammates Amin Gholami and Shixuan Zhang.

item.title: Misc

item.title: Research
item.description: Research Interest Topics of recent interests: Distributed and decomposition algorithms for continuous/discrete optimization Theory and algorithms based on nonconvex augmented Lagrangian duality Convexification and smoothing in optimization Sampling algorithms Publication and Preprint Log-difference-of-convex (Log-DC) sampling by the unadjusted Langevin Algorithm Jiaming Liang* , Kaizhao Sun, Enlu Zhou, and Andy Sun Submitted, 2021 Solving large-scale security-constrained optimal power flow problems Amin Gholami, Kaizhao Sun, Shixuan Zhang* , and Andy Sun Submitted, 2021 Algorithms for DC programs based on difference-of-Moreau-envelopes smoothing Kaizhao Sun and Andy Sun Submitted, 2021 Decomposition methods for global solutions of mixed-integer linear programs Kaizhao Sun, Mou Sun, and Wotao Yin Submitted, 2021 A two-level ADMM algorithm for AC OPF with global convergence guarantees Kaizhao Sun and Andy Sun Accepted at IEEE Transactions on Power Systems, 2021 A two-level distributed algorithm for nonconvex constrained optimization Kaizhao Sun and Andy Sun Submitted, 2019 * Optimization experts currently on the academic job market.
